result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie Cole Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.  May transfer to Milwaukee County, but not on day reporting or electronic monitoring.   CORRECTED 05-17-2016:  CFTS.
Concurrent with: with 15CF325

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnie Cole Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
From def re: AODA program. Fwd to Judge for review.

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Amended informations filed in each file.
Reading of both is waived.
Not guilty pleas entered by the Court.
Plea questionnaires filed.
Joint recommendation:  Plea to charges in each of the files.  2 yr probation.  No alcohol, controlled substances, RUAs, AODA and follow through.  Other appropriate counseling.  5 mos RCJ w/huber.  May be served in Milwaukee House of Corrections provided it is not on day reporting or electronic monitoring.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant re rights being waived, elements of charges and possible penalties.
State consents to jury waiver.
PLEA - guilty each of 3 counts
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently
Finding of guilt
Defendant's father speaks on behalf of defendant
State's sentencing argument
Defense sentencing argument
Defendant speaks on own behalf
BTC:  2 yrs probation
no alcohol, controlled substances; RUAs; AODA, aftercare
other appropriate counseling
5 mos RCJ w/huber.  May transfer to Milw Cty if not on ELM or day reporting
costs, assessments, surcharges 
no DNA surcharge on 325 file
60 DTP costs or 3 mos RCJ

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Robert Scott Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for COP/SEH
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Ronnie Cole in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RPD for entry.
